website_summaries.verdict: Made of ground steel and treated with heat, this multipurpose shaver is not as well-known as some other choices, but you may be satisfied if you're looking for a lower-cost product.
pros: Price is reasonable and one of the main attractions
cons: It may arrive in need of sharpening, and some find fault with the finish

customer_reviews.title: I enjoy this type of work
customer_reviews.text: This works very well, once you get it sharpened. The blade had file marks on from the factory. I literally spent about 2 hours removing them and getting a razor edge on it. I enjoy this type of work, but if you don't you might consider having it professionally sharpened. It does hold an edge very well and has darn near perfect balance
customer_reviews.author: Thomas T. Verga

customer_reviews.title: Expected a better finish on this sort of tool
customer_reviews.text: REALLY rough forging. None of the working surfaces and cutting edge were ground at all. Had to work on it a LONG time with my coarse stones to clean it up to where I could even begin to put a working edge on it. Could have used a CMT Extra Extra Coarse diamond bench stone. Otherwise, the steel seems OK so far. This is a tool best used for heavy stock prep. It is not a finesse tool.
customer_reviews.author: M. WRIGHT

customer_reviews.title: fair product
customer_reviews.text: it works, came rather dull...not best quality but it did what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Kristinbenson

customer_reviews.title: great drawknife but comes about as dull as something could ...
customer_reviews.text: great drawknife but comes about as dull as something could possibly be. I would let my 3 year old play with this thing
customer_reviews.author: Sydney

customer_reviews.title: Great draw knife with great price.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. My husband used it right out of the box with no issues. Stripped the bark from multiple trees very quickly. Showed up sharp and ready to go with a blade cover. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Davis

customer_reviews.title: Steel not hard enough
customer_reviews.text: Aside from the typical remarks that the tool needs sharpening, (not a showstopper for me), the steel is too soft. I destroyed the cutting edge by hitting a knot that was generously 1 inch in diameter. It's just too soft.
customer_reviews.author: Drewski_Brewski

customer_reviews.title: sturdy wood handles
customer_reviews.text: sturdy wood handles. comes dull - so it will need to be sharpened, but does so relatively easy. if you don't know how just youtube it. once sharp it pull easily through hickory and black walnut. I'm happy with the purchase and the fact that it's not cheap metal.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Dilts

customer_reviews.title: Solid built tool
customer_reviews.text: Solid built tool. Needed to be sharpened but work great.
customer_reviews.author: Gus Mctavish

customer_reviews.title: not bad, worth the money
customer_reviews.text: came really dull but worked well after a good sharpening, one of the handles kind of came loose after about half an hour of hard pulling.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Stone

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice tool. Easy to hold on to and has a lot of cutting edge.
customer_reviews.author: et

customer_reviews.title: A hand tool that was made to do the job!
customer_reviews.text: This draw knife was as I ordered. It is a well made hand tool, heavy steel. It will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: SteelandWood

product_meta.title: Koch Industries 4080057 Drawknife, 10-Inch
product_meta.description: Koch chain, wire and accessories are all manufactured to the highest specifications for quality. They are durable and easy to use in many application on the farm and in construction.
feature_bullets: One piece precision ground steel blade

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars15 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
